metadata.title: CVE-2018-5703 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The tcp_v6_syn_recv_sock function in net/ipv6/tcp_ipv6.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.14.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (slabout-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectorsinvolving TLS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-lowlatency - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-aws - 4.15.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-azure - 4.15.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1003-azure - 4.15.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-gcp - 4.15.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1003-gcp - 4.15.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-kvm - 4.15.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-13.14').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
